content: Determine the number of ways to arrange the letters in the word "MATH" without any restrictions.

To determine the number of ways to arrange the letters in the word "MATH" without any restrictions, we need to calculate the number of permutations of the four distinct letters M, A, T, and H.

Since all the letters are unique, the number of permutations is simply the factorial of the number of letters. The factorial of a number n, denoted as n!, is the product of all positive integers up to n.

In this case, there are 4 letters, so we calculate 4!:

4! = 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 24

Therefore, there are 24 different ways to arrange the letters in the word "MATH" without any restrictions.
